name: Kepler-196
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-196 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-196 is a star with 0.675 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.78 times its radius. It is located 1491.38 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-196 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-196 b

Kepler-196 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.74 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-196.

The mass of Kepler-196 b is 4.52 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-196 b is 1.9 that of Earth. At 4.52 Earth masses, Kepler-196 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-196 c

Kepler-196 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.24 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 47.43 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-196.

The mass of Kepler-196 c is 6.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-196 c is 2.24 that of Earth. At 6.68 Earth masses, Kepler-196 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-196, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
